entries.title: Nikkei Falls 0.9%, Dragged by Financial, Electronics Stocks
entries.description: Japanese stocks ended lower, dragged by falls in financial and electronics stocks, as concerns continued about signs of U.S. economic weakness.

entries.title: Musk Confirms Diverting Nvidia AI Chips Away From Tesla
entries.description: Elon Musk confirmed that many Nvidia Corp. chips initially intended for Tesla’s electric-vehicle production were diverted to X Corp. due to logistical challenges.

entries.title: Inditex Sales Grow But Pace Slows
entries.description: Zara owner Inditex said sales in the second quarter rose 12%, a slower pace of growth than in the same period last year but above expectations, buoyed by the continuing success of its spring/summer collections.

entries.title: Zambia Unlikely to Meet Copper Production Target as Disruptions Linger
entries.description: Zambia is unlikely to attain its copper production target of 3 million tons by 2032 as Africa’s second-biggest producer of the industrial metal grapples with electricity shortages and constrained financing occasioned by the debt crisis.

entries.title: BYD, NIO Get Approval to Test Automated Driving Technology on China Roads
entries.description: Chinese authorities have issued approvals for nine automakers, including BYD and NIO, to test their automated driving technology on roads.

entries.title: Fixed Income's Current Levels Offer Attractive Entry Point for Investors
entries.description: Fixed income remains a bright spot for investors given current yield levels, slowing growth, and continued disinflation, State Street Global Advisors said.

entries.title: Israel and Hezbollah Move Closer to Full-Scale War
entries.description: Months of escalating hostilities with the Lebanese militant group has added pressure on Israel’s government to secure its northern border.

entries.title: Americans Have More Investment Income Than Ever Before
entries.description: The economy’s charge through higher interest rates is putting unprecedented sums into consumers’ pockets. But the historic gains aren’t without a potential downside.

entries.title: Former Brexit Champion and Trump Supporter Shakes Up U.K. Election Race
entries.description: A staid British election campaign has been suddenly energized by the arrival of a now familiar troublemaker: Nigel Farage.

entries.title: Why Japan's Economy Is Stuck in the Past
entries.description: Japan is a country of contradictions. It’s often seen as a land of innovation, but it also has a strong attachment to tradition. WSJ’s Peter Landers explains how that is weighing down Japan’s economy.

entries.title: Tesla's sales in China rose 17% in May, as the country's demand for electric vehicles picked up, spurred by government trade-in programs.
entries.description: Tesla’s sales in China rose 17% in May, as the country’s demand for electric vehicles picked up, spurred by government trade-in programs.

entries.title: Cannabis producer Green Thumb Industries expressed interest in merging with Boston Beer, the maker of Sam Adams lager.
entries.description: Cannabis producer Green Thumb Industries expressed interest in merging with Boston Beer, the maker of Sam Adams lager.

entries.title: BlackRock and Citadel backed a group that plans to start a new national stock exchange in Texas to counter what it sees as onerous regulation at the NYSE and Nasdaq.
entries.description: BlackRock and Citadel backed a group that plans to start a new national stock exchange in Texas to counter what it sees as onerous regulation at the NYSE and Nasdaq.

entries.title: U.S. stocks rose modestly, with the S&P 500 overcoming an early deficit to close 0.2% higher and the Dow and Nasdaq gaining 0.4% and 0.2%, respectively.
entries.description: U.S. stocks rose modestly, with the S&P 500 overcoming an early deficit to close 0.2% higher and the Dow and Nasdaq gaining 0.4% and 0.2%, respectively.

entries.title: Hitachi and Microsoft announced a three-year, multibillion-dollar collaboration to accelerate the adoption of generative artificial intelligence, in their latest venture.
entries.description: Hitachi and Microsoft announced a three-year, multibillion-dollar collaboration to accelerate the adoption of generative artificial intelligence, in their latest venture.

entries.title: A group of employees in the artificial-intelligence industry said they can't voice concerns about AI's threat to humanity because of confidentiality agreements, a lack of whistleblower protections and the fear of retaliation.
entries.description: A group of employees in the artificial-intelligence industry said they can’t voice concerns about AI’s threat to humanity because of confidentiality agreements, a lack of whistleblower protections and the fear of retaliation.

entries.title: Declaring that "no one is above the law," a federal prosecutor kicked off the Justice Department's case against Hunter Biden on firearms charges.
entries.description: Declaring that “no one is above the law,” a federal prosecutor kicked off the Justice Department’s case  against Hunter Biden on firearms charges.

entries.title: Garland's appearance before a congressional panel devolved into a partisan brawl, with the attorney general accusing his Republican critics of peddling falsehoods that undermine the justice system.
entries.description: Garland’s appearance before a congressional panel devolved into a partisan brawl, with the attorney general accusing his Republican critics of peddling falsehoods that undermine the justice system.
